00051 char *tgt_name(struct lu_target *tgt)
00052 {
00053         LASSERT(tgt->lut_obd != NULL);
00054         return tgt->lut_obd->obd_name;
00055 }
00056 EXPORT_SYMBOL(tgt_name);
00057 
00058 /*
00059  * Generic code handling requests that have struct mdt_body passed in:
00060  *
00061  *  - extract mdt_body from request and save it in @tsi, if present;
00062  *
00063  *  - create lu_object, corresponding to the fid in mdt_body, and save it in
00064  *  @tsi;
00065  *
00066  *  - if HABEO_CORPUS flag is set for this request type check whether object
00067  *  actually exists on storage (lu_object_exists()).
00068  *
00069  */
00070 static int tgt_mdt_body_unpack(struct tgt_session_info *tsi, __u32 flags)
00071 {
00072         const struct mdt_body   *body;
00073         struct lu_object        *obj;
00074         struct req_capsule      *pill = tsi->tsi_pill;
00075         int                      rc;
00076 
00077         ENTRY;
00078 
00079         body = req_capsule_client_get(pill, &RMF_MDT_BODY);
00080         if (body == NULL)
00081                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
00082 
00083         tsi->tsi_mdt_body = body;
00084 
00085         if (!(body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLID))
00086                 RETURN(0);
00087 
00088         /* mdc_pack_body() doesn't check if fid is zero and set OBD_ML_FID
00089          * in any case in pre-2.5 clients. Fix that here if needed */
00090         if (unlikely(fid_is_zero(&body->mbo_fid1)))
00091                 RETURN(0);
00092 
00093         if (!fid_is_sane(&body->mbo_fid1)) {
00094                 CERROR("%s: invalid FID: "DFID"\n", tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt),
00095                        PFID(&body->mbo_fid1));
00096                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00097         }
00098 
00099         obj = lu_object_find(tsi->tsi_env,
00100                              &tsi->tsi_tgt->lut_bottom->dd_lu_dev,
00101                              &body->mbo_fid1, NULL);
00102         if (!IS_ERR(obj)) {
00103                 if ((flags & HABEO_CORPUS) && !lu_object_exists(obj)) {
00104                         lu_object_put(tsi->tsi_env, obj);
00105                         rc = -ENOENT;
00106                 } else {
00107                         tsi->tsi_corpus = obj;
00108                         rc = 0;
00109                 }
00110         } else {
00111                 rc = PTR_ERR(obj);
00112         }
00113 
00114         tsi->tsi_fid = body->mbo_fid1;
00115 
00116         RETURN(rc);
00117 }
00118 
00134 int tgt_validate_obdo(struct tgt_session_info *tsi, struct obdo *oa)
00135 {
00136         struct ost_id   *oi     = &oa->o_oi;
00137         u64              seq    = ostid_seq(oi);
00138         u64              id     = ostid_id(oi);
00139         int              rc;
00140         ENTRY;
00141 
00142         if (unlikely(!(exp_connect_flags(tsi->tsi_exp) & OBD_CONNECT_FID) &&
00143                      fid_seq_is_echo(seq))) {
00144                 /* Sigh 2.[123] client still sends echo req with oi_id = 0
00145                  * during create, and we will reset this to 1, since this
00146                  * oi_id is basically useless in the following create process,
00147                  * but oi_id == 0 will make it difficult to tell whether it is
00148                  * real FID or ost_id. */
00149                 oi->oi_fid.f_seq = FID_SEQ_ECHO;
00150                 oi->oi_fid.f_oid = id ?: 1;
00151                 oi->oi_fid.f_ver = 0;
00152         } else {
00153                 struct tgt_thread_info *tti = tgt_th_info(tsi->tsi_env);
00154 
00155                 if (unlikely((oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLID) && id == 0))
00156                         GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
00157 
00158                 /* Note: this check might be forced in 2.5 or 2.6, i.e.
00159                  * all of the requests are required to setup FLGROUP */
00160                 if (unlikely(!(oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLGROUP))) {
00161                         ostid_set_seq_mdt0(oi);
00162                         oa->o_valid |= OBD_MD_FLGROUP;
00163                         seq = ostid_seq(oi);
00164                 }
00165 
00166                 if (unlikely(!(fid_seq_is_idif(seq) || fid_seq_is_mdt0(seq) ||
00167                                fid_seq_is_norm(seq) || fid_seq_is_echo(seq))))
00168                         GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
00169 
00170                 rc = ostid_to_fid(&tti->tti_fid1, oi,
00171                                   tsi->tsi_tgt->lut_lsd.lsd_osd_index);
00172                 if (unlikely(rc != 0))
00173                         GOTO(out, rc);
00174 
00175                 oi->oi_fid = tti->tti_fid1;
00176         }
00177 
00178         RETURN(0);
00179 
00180 out:
00181         CERROR("%s: client %s sent bad object "DOSTID": rc = %d\n",
00182                tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), obd_export_nid2str(tsi->tsi_exp),
00183                seq, id, rc);
00184         return rc;
00185 }
00186 EXPORT_SYMBOL(tgt_validate_obdo);
00187 
00188 static int tgt_io_data_unpack(struct tgt_session_info *tsi, struct ost_id *oi)
00189 {
00190         unsigned                 max_brw;
00191         struct niobuf_remote    *rnb;
00192         struct obd_ioobj        *ioo;
00193         int                      obj_count;
00194 
00195         ENTRY;
00196 
00197         ioo = req_capsule_client_get(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_OBD_IOOBJ);
00198         if (ioo == NULL)
00199                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00200 
00201         rnb = req_capsule_client_get(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_NIOBUF_REMOTE);
00202         if (rnb == NULL)
00203                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00204 
00205         max_brw = ioobj_max_brw_get(ioo);
00206         if (unlikely((max_brw & (max_brw - 1)) != 0)) {
00207                 CERROR("%s: client %s sent bad ioobj max %u for "DOSTID
00208                        ": rc = %d\n", tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt),
00209                        obd_export_nid2str(tsi->tsi_exp), max_brw,
00210                        POSTID(oi), -EPROTO);
00211                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00212         }
00213         ioo->ioo_oid = *oi;
00214 
00215         obj_count = req_capsule_get_size(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_OBD_IOOBJ,
00216                                         RCL_CLIENT) / sizeof(*ioo);
00217         if (obj_count == 0) {
00218                 CERROR("%s: short ioobj\n", tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt));
00219                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00220         } else if (obj_count > 1) {
00221                 CERROR("%s: too many ioobjs (%d)\n", tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt),
00222                        obj_count);
00223                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00224         }
00225 
00226         if (ioo->ioo_bufcnt == 0) {
00227                 CERROR("%s: ioo has zero bufcnt\n", tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt));
00228                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00229         }
00230 
00231         if (ioo->ioo_bufcnt > PTLRPC_MAX_BRW_PAGES) {
00232                 DEBUG_REQ(D_RPCTRACE, tgt_ses_req(tsi),
00233                           "bulk has too many pages (%d)",
00234                           ioo->ioo_bufcnt);
00235                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00236         }
00237 
00238         RETURN(0);
00239 }
00240 
00241 static int tgt_ost_body_unpack(struct tgt_session_info *tsi, __u32 flags)
00242 {
00243         struct ost_body         *body;
00244         struct req_capsule      *pill = tsi->tsi_pill;
00245         struct lu_nodemap       *nodemap;
00246         int                      rc;
00247 
00248         ENTRY;
00249 
00250         body = req_capsule_client_get(pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
00251         if (body == NULL)
00252                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
00253 
00254         rc = tgt_validate_obdo(tsi, &body->oa);
00255         if (rc)
00256                 RETURN(rc);
00257 
00258         nodemap = tsi->tsi_exp->exp_target_data.ted_nodemap;
00259 
00260         body->oa.o_uid = nodemap_map_id(nodemap, NODEMAP_UID,
00261                                         NODEMAP_CLIENT_TO_FS,
00262                                         body->oa.o_uid);
00263         body->oa.o_gid = nodemap_map_id(nodemap, NODEMAP_GID,
00264                                         NODEMAP_CLIENT_TO_FS,
00265                                         body->oa.o_gid);
00266 
00267         tsi->tsi_ost_body = body;
00268         tsi->tsi_fid = body->oa.o_oi.oi_fid;
00269 
00270         if (req_capsule_has_field(pill, &RMF_OBD_IOOBJ, RCL_CLIENT)) {
00271                 rc = tgt_io_data_unpack(tsi, &body->oa.o_oi);
00272                 if (rc < 0)
00273                         RETURN(rc);
00274         }
00275 
00276         if (!(body->oa.o_valid & OBD_MD_FLID)) {
00277                 if (flags & HABEO_CORPUS) {
00278                         CERROR("%s: OBD_MD_FLID flag is not set in ost_body "
00279                                "but OID/FID is mandatory with HABEO_CORPUS\n",
00280                                tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt));
00281                         RETURN(-EPROTO);
00282                 } else {
00283                         RETURN(0);
00284                 }
00285         }
00286 
00287         ost_fid_build_resid(&tsi->tsi_fid, &tsi->tsi_resid);
00288 
00289         /*
00290          * OST doesn't get object in advance for further use to prevent
00291          * situations with nested object_find which is potential deadlock.
00292          */
00293         tsi->tsi_corpus = NULL;
00294         RETURN(rc);
00295 }
00296 
00297 /*
00298  * Do necessary preprocessing according to handler ->th_flags.
00299  */
00300 static int tgt_request_preprocess(struct tgt_session_info *tsi,
00301                                   struct tgt_handler *h,
00302                                   struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00303 {
00304         struct req_capsule      *pill = tsi->tsi_pill;
00305         __u32                    flags = h->th_flags;
00306         int                      rc = 0;
00307 
00308         ENTRY;
00309 
00310         if (tsi->tsi_preprocessed)
00311                 RETURN(0);
00312 
00313         LASSERT(h->th_act != NULL);
00314         LASSERT(h->th_opc == lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg));
00315         LASSERT(current->journal_info == NULL);
00316 
00317         LASSERT(ergo(flags & (HABEO_CORPUS | HABEO_REFERO),
00318                      h->th_fmt != NULL));
00319         if (h->th_fmt != NULL) {
00320                 req_capsule_set(pill, h->th_fmt);
00321                 if (req_capsule_has_field(pill, &RMF_MDT_BODY, RCL_CLIENT)) {
00322                         rc = tgt_mdt_body_unpack(tsi, flags);
00323                         if (rc < 0)
00324                                 RETURN(rc);
00325                 } else if (req_capsule_has_field(pill, &RMF_OST_BODY,
00326                                                  RCL_CLIENT)) {
00327                         rc = tgt_ost_body_unpack(tsi, flags);
00328                         if (rc < 0)
00329                                 RETURN(rc);
00330                 }
00331         }
00332 
00333         if (flags & MUTABOR && tgt_conn_flags(tsi) & OBD_CONNECT_RDONLY)
00334                 RETURN(-EROFS);
00335 
00336         if (flags & HABEO_CLAVIS) {
00337                 struct ldlm_request *dlm_req;
00338 
00339                 LASSERT(h->th_fmt != NULL);
00340 
00341                 dlm_req = req_capsule_client_get(pill, &RMF_DLM_REQ);
00342                 if (dlm_req != NULL) {
00343                         if (unlikely(dlm_req->lock_desc.l_resource.lr_type ==
00344                                      LDLM_IBITS &&
00345                                      dlm_req->lock_desc.l_policy_data.\
00346                                      l_inodebits.bits == 0)) {
00347                                 /*
00348                                  * Lock without inodebits makes no sense and
00349                                  * will oops later in ldlm. If client miss to
00350                                  * set such bits, do not trigger ASSERTION.
00351                                  *
00352                                  * For liblustre flock case, it maybe zero.
00353                                  */
00354                                 rc = -EPROTO;
00355                         } else {
00356                                 tsi->tsi_dlm_req = dlm_req;
00357                         }
00358                 } else {
00359                         rc = -EFAULT;
00360                 }
00361         }
00362         tsi->tsi_preprocessed = 1;
00363         RETURN(rc);
00364 }
00365 
00366 /*
00367  * Invoke handler for this request opc. Also do necessary preprocessing
00368  * (according to handler ->th_flags), and post-processing (setting of
00369  * ->last_{xid,committed}).
00370  */
00371 static int tgt_handle_request0(struct tgt_session_info *tsi,
00372                                struct tgt_handler *h,
00373                                struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00374 {
00375         int      serious = 0;
00376         int      rc;
00377         __u32    opc = lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg);
00378 
00379         ENTRY;
00380 
00381 
00382         /* When dealing with sec context requests, no export is associated yet,
00383          * because these requests are sent before *_CONNECT requests.
00384          * A NULL req->rq_export means the normal *_common_slice handlers will
00385          * not be called, because there is no reference to the target.
00386          * So deal with them by hand and jump directly to target_send_reply().
00387          */
00388         switch (opc) {
00389         case SEC_CTX_INIT:
00390         case SEC_CTX_INIT_CONT:
00391         case SEC_CTX_FINI:
00392                 CFS_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_SEC_CTX_HDL_PAUSE, cfs_fail_val);
00393                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00394         }
00395 
00396         /*
00397          * Checking for various OBD_FAIL_$PREF_$OPC_NET codes. _Do_ not try
00398          * to put same checks into handlers like mdt_close(), mdt_reint(),
00399          * etc., without talking to mdt authors first. Checking same thing
00400          * there again is useless and returning 0 error without packing reply
00401          * is buggy! Handlers either pack reply or return error.
00402          *
00403          * We return 0 here and do not send any reply in order to emulate
00404          * network failure. Do not send any reply in case any of NET related
00405          * fail_id has occured.
00406          */
00407         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK_ORSET(h->th_fail_id, OBD_FAIL_ONCE))
00408                 RETURN(0);
00409         if (unlikely(lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg) == MDS_REINT &&
00410                      OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_MDS_REINT_MULTI_NET)))
00411                 RETURN(0);
00412 
00413         rc = tgt_request_preprocess(tsi, h, req);
00414         /* pack reply if reply format is fixed */
00415         if (rc == 0 && h->th_flags & HABEO_REFERO) {
00416                 /* Pack reply */
00417                 if (req_capsule_has_field(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_MDT_MD,
00418                                           RCL_SERVER))
00419                         req_capsule_set_size(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_MDT_MD,
00420                                              RCL_SERVER,
00421                                              tsi->tsi_mdt_body->mbo_eadatasize);
00422                 if (req_capsule_has_field(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_LOGCOOKIES,
00423                                           RCL_SERVER))
00424                         req_capsule_set_size(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_LOGCOOKIES,
00425                                              RCL_SERVER, 0);
00426 
00427                 rc = req_capsule_server_pack(tsi->tsi_pill);
00428         }
00429 
00430         if (likely(rc == 0)) {
00431                 /*
00432                  * Process request, there can be two types of rc:
00433                  * 1) errors with msg unpack/pack, other failures outside the
00434                  * operation itself. This is counted as serious errors;
00435                  * 2) errors during fs operation, should be placed in rq_status
00436                  * only
00437                  */
00438                 rc = h->th_act(tsi);
00439                 if (!is_serious(rc) &&
00440                     !req->rq_no_reply && req->rq_reply_state == NULL) {
00441                         DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "%s \"handler\" %s did not "
00442                                   "pack reply and returned 0 error\n",
00443                                   tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), h->th_name);
00444                         LBUG();
00445                 }
00446                 serious = is_serious(rc);
00447                 rc = clear_serious(rc);
00448         } else {
00449                 serious = 1;
00450         }
00451 
00452         req->rq_status = rc;
00453 
00454         /*
00455          * ELDLM_* codes which > 0 should be in rq_status only as well as
00456          * all non-serious errors.
00457          */
00458         if (rc > 0 || !serious)
00459                 rc = 0;
00460 
00461         LASSERT(current->journal_info == NULL);
00462 
00463         if (likely(rc == 0 && req->rq_export))
00464                 target_committed_to_req(req);
00465 
00466 out:
00467         target_send_reply(req, rc, tsi->tsi_reply_fail_id);
00468         RETURN(0);
00469 }
00470 
00471 static int tgt_filter_recovery_request(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00472                                        struct obd_device *obd, int *process)
00473 {
00474         switch (lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg)) {
00475         case MDS_DISCONNECT:
00476         case OST_DISCONNECT:
00477         case OBD_IDX_READ:
00478                 *process = 1;
00479                 RETURN(0);
00480         case MDS_CLOSE:
00481         case MDS_SYNC: /* used in unmounting */
00482         case OBD_PING:
00483         case MDS_REINT:
00484         case OUT_UPDATE:
00485         case SEQ_QUERY:
00486         case FLD_QUERY:
00487         case FLD_READ:
00488         case LDLM_ENQUEUE:
00489         case OST_CREATE:
00490         case OST_DESTROY:
00491         case OST_PUNCH:
00492         case OST_SETATTR:
00493         case OST_SYNC:
00494         case OST_WRITE:
00495         case MDS_HSM_PROGRESS:
00496         case MDS_HSM_STATE_SET:
00497         case MDS_HSM_REQUEST:
00498                 *process = target_queue_recovery_request(req, obd);
00499                 RETURN(0);
00500 
00501         default:
00502                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "not permitted during recovery");
00503                 *process = -EAGAIN;
00504                 RETURN(0);
00505         }
00506 }
00507 
00508 /*
00509  * Handle recovery. Return:
00510  *        +1: continue request processing;
00511  *       -ve: abort immediately with the given error code;
00512  *         0: send reply with error code in req->rq_status;
00513  */
00514 static int tgt_handle_recovery(struct ptlrpc_request *req, int reply_fail_id)
00515 {
00516         ENTRY;
00517 
00518         switch (lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg)) {
00519         case MDS_CONNECT:
00520         case OST_CONNECT:
00521         case MGS_CONNECT:
00522         case SEC_CTX_INIT:
00523         case SEC_CTX_INIT_CONT:
00524         case SEC_CTX_FINI:
00525                 RETURN(+1);
00526         }
00527 
00528         if (!req->rq_export->exp_obd->obd_replayable)
00529                 RETURN(+1);
00530 
00531         /* sanity check: if the xid matches, the request must be marked as a
00532          * resent or replayed */
00533         if (req_can_reconstruct(req, NULL)) {
00534                 if (!(lustre_msg_get_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) &
00535                       (MSG_RESENT | MSG_REPLAY))) {
00536                         DEBUG_REQ(D_WARNING, req, "rq_xid "LPU64" matches "
00537                                   "saved xid, expected REPLAY or RESENT flag "
00538                                   "(%x)", req->rq_xid,
00539                                   lustre_msg_get_flags(req->rq_reqmsg));
00540                         req->rq_status = -ENOTCONN;
00541                         RETURN(-ENOTCONN);
00542                 }
00543         }
00544         /* else: note the opposite is not always true; a RESENT req after a
00545          * failover will usually not match the last_xid, since it was likely
00546          * never committed. A REPLAYed request will almost never match the
00547          * last xid, however it could for a committed, but still retained,
00548          * open. */
00549 
00550         /* Check for aborted recovery... */
00551         if (unlikely(req->rq_export->exp_obd->obd_recovering)) {
00552                 int rc;
00553                 int should_process;
00554 
00555                 DEBUG_REQ(D_INFO, req, "Got new replay");
00556                 rc = tgt_filter_recovery_request(req, req->rq_export->exp_obd,
00557                                                  &should_process);
00558                 if (rc != 0 || !should_process)
00559                         RETURN(rc);
00560                 else if (should_process < 0) {
00561                         req->rq_status = should_process;
00562                         rc = ptlrpc_error(req);
00563                         RETURN(rc);
00564                 }
00565         }
00566         RETURN(+1);
00567 }
00568 
00569 /* Initial check for request, it is validation mostly */
00570 static struct tgt_handler *tgt_handler_find_check(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00571 {
00572         struct tgt_handler      *h;
00573         struct tgt_opc_slice    *s;
00574         struct lu_target        *tgt;
00575         __u32                    opc = lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg);
00576 
00577         ENTRY;
00578 
00579         tgt = class_exp2tgt(req->rq_export);
00580         if (unlikely(tgt == NULL)) {
00581                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "%s: No target for connected export\n",
00582                           class_exp2obd(req->rq_export)->obd_name);
00583                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-EINVAL));
00584         }
00585 
00586         for (s = tgt->lut_slice; s->tos_hs != NULL; s++)
00587                 if (s->tos_opc_start <= opc && opc < s->tos_opc_end)
00588                         break;
00589 
00590         /* opcode was not found in slice */
00591         if (unlikely(s->tos_hs == NULL)) {
00592                 CERROR("%s: no handlers for opcode 0x%x\n", tgt_name(tgt),
00593                        opc);
00594                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOTSUPP));
00595         }
00596 
00597         LASSERT(opc >= s->tos_opc_start && opc < s->tos_opc_end);
00598         h = s->tos_hs + (opc - s->tos_opc_start);
00599         if (unlikely(h->th_opc == 0)) {
00600                 CERROR("%s: unsupported opcode 0x%x\n", tgt_name(tgt), opc);
00601                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOTSUPP));
00602         }
00603 
00604         RETURN(h);
00605 }
00606 
00607 static int process_req_last_xid(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00608 {
00609         __u64   last_xid;
00610         ENTRY;
00611 
00612         /* check request's xid is consistent with export's last_xid */
00613         last_xid = lustre_msg_get_last_xid(req->rq_reqmsg);
00614         if (last_xid > req->rq_export->exp_last_xid)
00615                 req->rq_export->exp_last_xid = last_xid;
00616 
00617         if (req->rq_xid == 0 ||
00618             (req->rq_xid <= req->rq_export->exp_last_xid)) {
00619                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "Unexpected xid %llx vs. "
00620                           "last_xid %llx\n", req->rq_xid,
00621                           req->rq_export->exp_last_xid);
00622                 /* Some request is allowed to be sent during replay,
00623                  * such as OUT update requests, FLD requests, so it
00624                  * is possible that replay requests has smaller XID
00625                  * than the exp_last_xid.
00626                  *
00627                  * Some non-replay requests may have smaller XID as
00628                  * well:
00629                  *
00630                  * - Client send a no_resend RPC, like statfs;
00631                  * - The RPC timedout (or some other error) on client,
00632                  *   then it's removed from the unreplied list;
00633                  * - Client send some other request to bump the
00634                  *   exp_last_xid on server;
00635                  * - The former RPC got chance to be processed;
00636                  */
00637                 if (!(lustre_msg_get_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) & MSG_REPLAY))
00638                         RETURN(-EPROTO);
00639         }
00640 
00641         /* try to release in-memory reply data */
00642         if (tgt_is_multimodrpcs_client(req->rq_export)) {
00643                 tgt_handle_received_xid(req->rq_export,
00644                                 lustre_msg_get_last_xid(req->rq_reqmsg));
00645                 if (!(lustre_msg_get_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) &
00646                       (MSG_RESENT | MSG_REPLAY)))
00647                         tgt_handle_tag(req->rq_export,
00648                                        lustre_msg_get_tag(req->rq_reqmsg));
00649         }
00650         RETURN(0);
00651 }
00652 
00653 int tgt_request_handle(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00654 {
00655         struct tgt_session_info *tsi = tgt_ses_info(req->rq_svc_thread->t_env);
00656 
00657         struct lustre_msg       *msg = req->rq_reqmsg;
00658         struct tgt_handler      *h;
00659         struct lu_target        *tgt;
00660         int                      request_fail_id = 0;
00661         __u32                    opc = lustre_msg_get_opc(msg);
00662         struct obd_device       *obd;
00663         int                      rc;
00664         bool                     is_connect = false;
00665         ENTRY;
00666 
00667         /* Refill the context, to make sure all thread keys are allocated */
00668         lu_env_refill(req->rq_svc_thread->t_env);
00669 
00670         req_capsule_init(&req->rq_pill, req, RCL_SERVER);
00671         tsi->tsi_pill = &req->rq_pill;
00672         tsi->tsi_env = req->rq_svc_thread->t_env;
00673 
00674         /* if request has export then get handlers slice from corresponding
00675          * target, otherwise that should be connect operation */
00676         if (opc == MDS_CONNECT || opc == OST_CONNECT ||
00677             opc == MGS_CONNECT) {
00678                 is_connect = true;
00679                 req_capsule_set(&req->rq_pill, &RQF_CONNECT);
00680                 rc = target_handle_connect(req);
00681                 if (rc != 0) {
00682                         rc = ptlrpc_error(req);
00683                         GOTO(out, rc);
00684                 }
00685                 /* recovery-small test 18c asks to drop connect reply */
00686                 if (unlikely(opc == OST_CONNECT &&
00687                              OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OST_CONNECT_NET2)))
00688                         GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00689         }
00690 
00691         if (unlikely(!class_connected_export(req->rq_export))) {
00692                 if (opc == SEC_CTX_INIT || opc == SEC_CTX_INIT_CONT ||
00693                     opc == SEC_CTX_FINI) {
00694                         /* sec context initialization has to be handled
00695                          * by hand in tgt_handle_request0() */
00696                         tsi->tsi_reply_fail_id = OBD_FAIL_SEC_CTX_INIT_NET;
00697                         h = NULL;
00698                         GOTO(handle_recov, rc = 0);
00699                 }
00700                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "operation %d on unconnected OST from %s\n",
00701                        opc, libcfs_id2str(req->rq_peer));
00702                 req->rq_status = -ENOTCONN;
00703                 rc = ptlrpc_error(req);
00704                 GOTO(out, rc);
00705         }
00706 
00707         tsi->tsi_tgt = tgt = class_exp2tgt(req->rq_export);
00708         tsi->tsi_exp = req->rq_export;
00709         if (exp_connect_flags(req->rq_export) & OBD_CONNECT_JOBSTATS)
00710                 tsi->tsi_jobid = lustre_msg_get_jobid(req->rq_reqmsg);
00711         else
00712                 tsi->tsi_jobid = NULL;
00713 
00714         if (tgt == NULL) {
00715                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "%s: No target for connected export\n",
00716                           class_exp2obd(req->rq_export)->obd_name);
00717                 req->rq_status = -EINVAL;
00718                 rc = ptlrpc_error(req);
00719                 GOTO(out, rc);
00720         }
00721 
00722         /* Skip last_xid processing for the recovery thread, otherwise, the
00723          * last_xid on same request could be processed twice: first time when
00724          * processing the incoming request, second time when the request is
00725          * being processed by recovery thread. */
00726         obd = class_exp2obd(req->rq_export);
00727         if (is_connect) {
00728                 /* reset the exp_last_xid on each connection. */
00729                 req->rq_export->exp_last_xid = 0;
00730         } else if (obd->obd_recovery_data.trd_processing_task !=
00731                    current_pid()) {
00732                 rc = process_req_last_xid(req);
00733                 if (rc) {
00734                         req->rq_status = rc;
00735                         rc = ptlrpc_error(req);
00736                         GOTO(out, rc);
00737                 }
00738         }
00739 
00740         request_fail_id = tgt->lut_request_fail_id;
00741         tsi->tsi_reply_fail_id = tgt->lut_reply_fail_id;
00742 
00743         h = tgt_handler_find_check(req);
00744         if (IS_ERR(h)) {
00745                 req->rq_status = PTR_ERR(h);
00746                 rc = ptlrpc_error(req);
00747                 GOTO(out, rc);
00748         }
00749 
00750         LASSERTF(h->th_opc == opc, "opcode mismatch %d != %d\n",
00751                  h->th_opc, opc);
00752 
00753         if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK_ORSET(request_fail_id, CFS_FAIL_ONCE))
00754                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00755 
00756         rc = lustre_msg_check_version(msg, h->th_version);
00757         if (unlikely(rc)) {
00758                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "%s: drop mal-formed request, version"
00759                           " %08x, expecting %08x\n", tgt_name(tgt),
00760                           lustre_msg_get_version(msg), h->th_version);
00761                 req->rq_status = -EINVAL;
00762                 rc = ptlrpc_error(req);
00763                 GOTO(out, rc);
00764         }
00765 
00766 handle_recov:
00767         rc = tgt_handle_recovery(req, tsi->tsi_reply_fail_id);
00768         if (likely(rc == 1)) {
00769                 rc = tgt_handle_request0(tsi, h, req);
00770                 if (rc)
00771                         GOTO(out, rc);
00772         }
00773         EXIT;
00774 out:
00775         req_capsule_fini(tsi->tsi_pill);
00776         if (tsi->tsi_corpus != NULL) {
00777                 lu_object_put(tsi->tsi_env, tsi->tsi_corpus);
00778                 tsi->tsi_corpus = NULL;
00779         }
00780         return rc;
00781 }
00782 EXPORT_SYMBOL(tgt_request_handle);
00783 
00785 int tgt_hpreq_handler(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00786 {
00787         struct tgt_session_info *tsi = tgt_ses_info(req->rq_svc_thread->t_env);
00788         struct tgt_handler      *h;
00789         int                      rc;
00790 
00791         ENTRY;
00792 
00793         if (req->rq_export == NULL)
00794                 RETURN(0);
00795 
00796         req_capsule_init(&req->rq_pill, req, RCL_SERVER);
00797         tsi->tsi_pill = &req->rq_pill;
00798         tsi->tsi_env = req->rq_svc_thread->t_env;
00799         tsi->tsi_tgt = class_exp2tgt(req->rq_export);
00800         tsi->tsi_exp = req->rq_export;
00801 
00802         h = tgt_handler_find_check(req);
00803         if (IS_ERR(h)) {
00804                 rc = PTR_ERR(h);
00805                 RETURN(rc);
00806         }
00807 
00808         rc = tgt_request_preprocess(tsi, h, req);
00809         if (unlikely(rc != 0))
00810                 RETURN(rc);
00811 
00812         if (h->th_hp != NULL)
00813                 h->th_hp(tsi);
00814         RETURN(0);
00815 }
00816 EXPORT_SYMBOL(tgt_hpreq_handler);
00817 
00818 void tgt_counter_incr(struct obd_export *exp, int opcode)
00819 {
00820         lprocfs_counter_incr(exp->exp_obd->obd_stats, opcode);
00821         if (exp->exp_nid_stats && exp->exp_nid_stats->nid_stats != NULL)
00822                 lprocfs_counter_incr(exp->exp_nid_stats->nid_stats, opcode);
00823 }
00824 EXPORT_SYMBOL(tgt_counter_incr);
00825 
00826 /*
00827  * Unified target generic handlers.
00828  */
00829 
00830 /*
00831  * Security functions
00832  */
00833 static inline void tgt_init_sec_none(struct obd_connect_data *reply)
00834 {
00835         reply->ocd_connect_flags &= ~(OBD_CONNECT_RMT_CLIENT |
00836                                       OBD_CONNECT_RMT_CLIENT_FORCE);
00837 }
00838 
00839 static int tgt_init_sec_level(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00840 {
00841         struct lu_target        *tgt = class_exp2tgt(req->rq_export);
00842         char                    *client;
00843         struct obd_connect_data *data, *reply;
00844         int                      rc = 0;
00845         bool                     remote;
00846         ENTRY;
00847 
00848         data = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_CONNECT_DATA);
00849         reply = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_CONNECT_DATA);
00850         if (data == NULL || reply == NULL)
00851                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
00852 
00853         /* connection from MDT is always trusted */
00854         if (req->rq_auth_usr_mdt) {
00855                 tgt_init_sec_none(reply);
00856                 RETURN(0);
00857         }
00858 
00859         if (unlikely(tgt == NULL)) {
00860                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "%s: No target for connected export\n",
00861                           class_exp2obd(req->rq_export)->obd_name);
00862                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00863         }
00864 
00865         client = libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid);
00866         /* no GSS support case */
00867         if (!req->rq_auth_gss) {
00868                 if (tgt->lut_sec_level > LUSTRE_SEC_NONE) {
00869                         CWARN("client %s -> target %s does not use GSS, "
00870                               "can not run under security level %d.\n",
00871                               client, tgt_name(tgt), tgt->lut_sec_level);
00872                         RETURN(-EACCES);
00873                 } else {
00874                         tgt_init_sec_none(reply);
00875                         RETURN(0);
00876                 }
00877         }
00878 
00879         /* old version case */
00880         if (unlikely(!(data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_RMT_CLIENT) ||
00881                      !(data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_MDS_CAPA) ||
00882                      !(data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_OSS_CAPA))) {
00883                 if (tgt->lut_sec_level > LUSTRE_SEC_NONE) {
00884                         CWARN("client %s -> target %s uses old version, "
00885                               "can not run under security level %d.\n",
00886                               client, tgt_name(tgt), tgt->lut_sec_level);
00887                         RETURN(-EACCES);
00888                 } else {
00889                         CWARN("client %s -> target %s uses old version, "
00890                               "run under security level %d.\n",
00891                               client, tgt_name(tgt), tgt->lut_sec_level);
00892                         tgt_init_sec_none(reply);
00893                         RETURN(0);
00894                 }
00895         }
00896 
00897         remote = data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_RMT_CLIENT_FORCE;
00898         if (remote) {
00899                 if (!req->rq_auth_remote)
00900                         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "client (local realm) %s -> target %s "
00901                                "asked to be remote.\n", client, tgt_name(tgt));
00902         } else if (req->rq_auth_remote) {
00903                 remote = true;
00904                 CDEBUG(D_SEC, "client (remote realm) %s -> target %s is set "
00905                        "as remote by default.\n", client, tgt_name(tgt));
00906         }
00907 
00908         if (remote == 0) {
00909                 if (!uid_valid(make_kuid(&init_user_ns, req->rq_auth_uid))) {
00910                         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "client %s -> target %s: user is not "
00911                                "authenticated!\n", client, tgt_name(tgt));
00912                         RETURN(-EACCES);
00913                 }
00914         }
00915 
00916 
00917         switch (tgt->lut_sec_level) {
00918         case LUSTRE_SEC_NONE:
00919                 if (remote) {
00920                         CDEBUG(D_SEC,
00921                                "client %s -> target %s is set as remote, "
00922                                "can not run under security level %d.\n",
00923                                client, tgt_name(tgt), tgt->lut_sec_level);
00924                         RETURN(-EACCES);
00925                 }
00926                 tgt_init_sec_none(reply);
00927                 break;
00928         case LUSTRE_SEC_REMOTE:
00929                 if (!remote)
00930                         tgt_init_sec_none(reply);
00931                 break;
00932         case LUSTRE_SEC_ALL:
00933                 if (remote)
00934                         break;
00935                 reply->ocd_connect_flags &= ~(OBD_CONNECT_RMT_CLIENT |
00936                                               OBD_CONNECT_RMT_CLIENT_FORCE);
00937                 reply->ocd_connect_flags &= ~OBD_CONNECT_OSS_CAPA;
00938                 reply->ocd_connect_flags &= ~OBD_CONNECT_MDS_CAPA;
00939                 break;
00940         default:
00941                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00942         }
00943 
00944         RETURN(rc);
00945 }
00946 
00947 int tgt_connect_check_sptlrpc(struct ptlrpc_request *req, struct obd_export *exp)
00948 {
00949         struct lu_target        *tgt = class_exp2tgt(exp);
00950         struct sptlrpc_flavor    flvr;
00951         int                      rc = 0;
00952 
00953         LASSERT(tgt);
00954         LASSERT(tgt->lut_obd);
00955         LASSERT(tgt->lut_slice);
00956 
00957         /* always allow ECHO client */
00958         if (unlikely(strcmp(exp->exp_obd->obd_type->typ_name,
00959                             LUSTRE_ECHO_NAME) == 0)) {
00960                 exp->exp_flvr.sf_rpc = SPTLRPC_FLVR_ANY;
00961                 return 0;
00962         }
00963 
00964         if (exp->exp_flvr.sf_rpc == SPTLRPC_FLVR_INVALID) {
00965                 read_lock(&tgt->lut_sptlrpc_lock);
00966                 sptlrpc_target_choose_flavor(&tgt->lut_sptlrpc_rset,
00967                                              req->rq_sp_from,
00968                                              req->rq_peer.nid,
00969                                              &flvr);
00970                 read_unlock(&tgt->lut_sptlrpc_lock);
00971 
00972                 spin_lock(&exp->exp_lock);
00973                 exp->exp_sp_peer = req->rq_sp_from;
00974                 exp->exp_flvr = flvr;
00975 
00976                 /* when on mgs, if no restriction is set, or if client
00977                  * is loopback, allow any flavor */
00978                 if ((strcmp(exp->exp_obd->obd_type->typ_name,
00979                            LUSTRE_MGS_NAME) == 0) &&
00980                      (exp->exp_flvr.sf_rpc == SPTLRPC_FLVR_NULL ||
00981                       LNET_NETTYP(LNET_NIDNET(exp->exp_connection->c_peer.nid))
00982                       == LOLND))
00983                         exp->exp_flvr.sf_rpc = SPTLRPC_FLVR_ANY;
00984 
00985                 if (exp->exp_flvr.sf_rpc != SPTLRPC_FLVR_ANY &&
00986                     exp->exp_flvr.sf_rpc != req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc) {
00987                         CERROR("%s: unauthorized rpc flavor %x from %s, "
00988                                "expect %x\n", tgt_name(tgt),
00989                                req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc,
00990                                libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid),
00991                                exp->exp_flvr.sf_rpc);
00992                         rc = -EACCES;
00993                 }
00994                 spin_unlock(&exp->exp_lock);
00995         } else {
00996                 if (exp->exp_sp_peer != req->rq_sp_from) {
00997                         CERROR("%s: RPC source %s doesn't match %s\n",
00998                                tgt_name(tgt),
00999                                sptlrpc_part2name(req->rq_sp_from),
01000                                sptlrpc_part2name(exp->exp_sp_peer));
01001                         rc = -EACCES;
01002                 } else {
01003                         rc = sptlrpc_target_export_check(exp, req);
01004                 }
01005         }
01006 
01007         return rc;
01008 }
01009 
01010 int tgt_adapt_sptlrpc_conf(struct lu_target *tgt, int initial)
01011 {
01012         struct sptlrpc_rule_set  tmp_rset;
01013         int                      rc;
01014 
01015         if (unlikely(tgt == NULL)) {
01016                 CERROR("No target passed");
01017                 return -EINVAL;
01018         }
01019 
01020         sptlrpc_rule_set_init(&tmp_rset);
01021         rc = sptlrpc_conf_target_get_rules(tgt->lut_obd, &tmp_rset, initial);
01022         if (rc) {
01023                 CERROR("%s: failed get sptlrpc rules: rc = %d\n",
01024                        tgt_name(tgt), rc);
01025                 return rc;
01026         }
01027 
01028         sptlrpc_target_update_exp_flavor(tgt->lut_obd, &tmp_rset);
01029 
01030         write_lock(&tgt->lut_sptlrpc_lock);
01031         sptlrpc_rule_set_free(&tgt->lut_sptlrpc_rset);
01032         tgt->lut_sptlrpc_rset = tmp_rset;
01033         write_unlock(&tgt->lut_sptlrpc_lock);
01034 
01035         return 0;
01036 }
01037 EXPORT_SYMBOL(tgt_adapt_sptlrpc_conf);
01038 
01039 int tgt_connect(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
01040 {
01041         struct ptlrpc_request   *req = tgt_ses_req(tsi);
01042         struct obd_connect_data *reply;
01043         int                      rc;
01044 
01045         ENTRY;
01046 
01047         rc = tgt_init_sec_level(req);
01048         if (rc != 0)
01049                 GOTO(out, rc);
01050 
01051         /* XXX: better to call this check right after getting new export but
01052          * before last_rcvd slot allocation to avoid server load upon insecure
01053          * connects. This is to be fixed after unifiyng all targets.
01054          */
01055         rc = tgt_connect_check_sptlrpc(req, tsi->tsi_exp);
01056         if (rc)
01057                 GOTO(out, rc);
01058 
01059         /* To avoid exposing partially initialized connection flags, changes up
01060          * to this point have been staged in reply->ocd_connect_flags. Now that
01061          * connection handling has completed successfully, atomically update
01062          * the connect flags in the shared export data structure. LU-1623 */
01063         reply = req_capsule_server_get(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_CONNECT_DATA);
01064         spin_lock(&tsi->tsi_exp->exp_lock);
01065         *exp_connect_flags_ptr(tsi->tsi_exp) = reply->ocd_connect_flags;
01066         tsi->tsi_exp->exp_connect_data.ocd_brw_size = reply->ocd_brw_size;
01067         spin_unlock(&tsi->tsi_exp->exp_lock);
01068 
01069         RETURN(0);
01070 out:
01071         obd_disconnect(class_export_get(tsi->tsi_exp));
01072         return rc;
01073 }
01074 EXPORT_SYMBOL(tgt_connect);
01075 
01076 int tgt_disconnect(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
01077 {
01078         int rc;
01079 
01080         ENTRY;
01081 
01082         rc = target_handle_disconnect(tgt_ses_req(tsi));
01083         if (rc)
01084                 RETURN(err_serious(rc));
01085 
01086         RETURN(rc);
01087 }
01088 EXPORT_SYMBOL(tgt_disconnect);
01089 
01090 /*
01091  * Unified target OBD handlers
01092  */
01093 int tgt_obd_ping(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
01094 {
01095         int rc;
01096 
01097         ENTRY;
01098 
01099         rc = target_handle_ping(tgt_ses_req(tsi));
01100         if (rc)
01101                 RETURN(err_serious(rc));
01102 
01103         RETURN(rc);
01104 }
01105 EXPORT_SYMBOL(tgt_obd_ping);
01106 
01107 int tgt_obd_log_cancel(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
01108 {
01109         return err_serious(-EOPNOTSUPP);
01110 }
01111 
01112 int tgt_send_buffer(struct tgt_session_info *tsi, struct lu_rdbuf *rdbuf)
01113 {
01114         struct tgt_thread_info  *tti = tgt_th_info(tsi->tsi_env);
01115         struct ptlrpc_request   *req = tgt_ses_req(tsi);
01116         struct obd_export       *exp = req->rq_export;
01117         struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc *desc;
01118         struct l_wait_info      *lwi = &tti->tti_u.update.tti_wait_info;
01119         int                      i;
01120         int                      rc;
01121 
01122         ENTRY;
01123 
01124         desc = ptlrpc_prep_bulk_exp(req, rdbuf->rb_nbufs, 1,
01125                                   PTLRPC_BULK_PUT_SOURCE | PTLRPC_BULK_BUF_KVEC,
01126                                     MDS_BULK_PORTAL, &ptlrpc_bulk_kvec_ops);
01127         if (desc == NULL)
01128                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01129 
01130         for (i = 0; i < rdbuf->rb_nbufs; i++)
01131                 desc->bd_frag_ops->add_iov_frag(desc,
01132                                         rdbuf->rb_bufs[i].lb_buf,
01133                                         rdbuf->rb_bufs[i].lb_len);
01134 
01135         rc = target_bulk_io(exp, desc, lwi);
01136         ptlrpc_free_bulk(desc);
01137         RETURN(rc);
01138 }
01139 EXPORT_SYMBOL(tgt_send_buffer);
01140 
01141 int tgt_sendpage(struct tgt_session_info *tsi, struct lu_rdpg *rdpg, int nob)
01142 {
01143         struct tgt_thread_info  *tti = tgt_th_info(tsi->tsi_env);
01144         struct ptlrpc_request   *req = tgt_ses_req(tsi);
01145         struct obd_export       *exp = req->rq_export;
01146         struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc *desc;
01147         struct l_wait_info      *lwi = &tti->tti_u.rdpg.tti_wait_info;
01148         int                      tmpcount;
01149         int                      tmpsize;
01150         int                      i;
01151         int                      rc;
01152 
01153         ENTRY;
01154 
01155         desc = ptlrpc_prep_bulk_exp(req, rdpg->rp_npages, 1,
01156                                     PTLRPC_BULK_PUT_SOURCE |
01157                                         PTLRPC_BULK_BUF_KIOV,
01158                                     MDS_BULK_PORTAL,
01159                                     &ptlrpc_bulk_kiov_pin_ops);
01160         if (desc == NULL)
01161                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01162 
01163         if (!(exp_connect_flags(exp) & OBD_CONNECT_BRW_SIZE))
01164                 /* old client requires reply size in it's PAGE_CACHE_SIZE,
01165                  * which is rdpg->rp_count */
01166                 nob = rdpg->rp_count;
01167 
01168         for (i = 0, tmpcount = nob; i < rdpg->rp_npages && tmpcount > 0;
01169              i++, tmpcount -= tmpsize) {
01170                 tmpsize = min_t(int, tmpcount, PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
01171                 desc->bd_frag_ops->add_kiov_frag(desc, rdpg->rp_pages[i], 0,
01172                                                  tmpsize);
01173         }
01174 
01175         LASSERT(desc->bd_nob == nob);
01176         rc = target_bulk_io(exp, desc, lwi);
01177         ptlrpc_free_bulk(desc);
01178         RETURN(rc);
01179 }
01180 EXPORT_SYMBOL(tgt_sendpage);
01181 
01182 /*
01183  * OBD_IDX_READ handler
01184  */
01185 static int tgt_obd_idx_read(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
01186 {
01187         struct tgt_thread_info  *tti = tgt_th_info(tsi->tsi_env);
01188         struct lu_rdpg          *rdpg = &tti->tti_u.rdpg.tti_rdpg;
01189         struct idx_info         *req_ii, *rep_ii;
01190         int                      rc, i;
01191 
01192         ENTRY;
01193 
01194         memset(rdpg, 0, sizeof(*rdpg));
01195         req_capsule_set(tsi->tsi_pill, &RQF_OBD_IDX_READ);
01196 
01197         /* extract idx_info buffer from request & reply */
01198         req_ii = req_capsule_client_get(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_IDX_INFO);
01199         if (req_ii == NULL || req_ii->ii_magic != IDX_INFO_MAGIC)
01200                 RETURN(err_serious(-EPROTO));
01201 
01202         rc = req_capsule_server_pack(tsi->tsi_pill);
01203         if (rc)
01204                 RETURN(err_serious(rc));
01205 
01206         rep_ii = req_capsule_server_get(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_IDX_INFO);
01207         if (rep_ii == NULL)
01208                 RETURN(err_serious(-EFAULT));
01209         rep_ii->ii_magic = IDX_INFO_MAGIC;
01210 
01211         /* extract hash to start with */
01212         rdpg->rp_hash = req_ii->ii_hash_start;
01213 
01214         /* extract requested attributes */
01215         rdpg->rp_attrs = req_ii->ii_attrs;
01216 
01217         /* check that fid packed in request is valid and supported */
01218         if (!fid_is_sane(&req_ii->ii_fid))
01219                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01220         rep_ii->ii_fid = req_ii->ii_fid;
01221 
01222         /* copy flags */
01223         rep_ii->ii_flags = req_ii->ii_flags;
01224 
01225         /* compute number of pages to allocate, ii_count is the number of 4KB
01226          * containers */
01227         if (req_ii->ii_count <= 0)
01228                 GOTO(out, rc = -EFAULT);
01229         rdpg->rp_count = min_t(unsigned int, req_ii->ii_count << LU_PAGE_SHIFT,
01230                                exp_max_brw_size(tsi->tsi_exp));
01231         rdpg->rp_npages = (rdpg->rp_count + PAGE_CACHE_SIZE -1) >> PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
01232 
01233         /* allocate pages to store the containers */
01234         OBD_ALLOC(rdpg->rp_pages, rdpg->rp_npages * sizeof(rdpg->rp_pages[0]));
01235         if (rdpg->rp_pages == NULL)
01236                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01237         for (i = 0; i < rdpg->rp_npages; i++) {
01238                 rdpg->rp_pages[i] = alloc_page(GFP_IOFS);
01239                 if (rdpg->rp_pages[i] == NULL)
01240                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01241         }
01242 
01243         /* populate pages with key/record pairs */
01244         rc = dt_index_read(tsi->tsi_env, tsi->tsi_tgt->lut_bottom, rep_ii, rdpg);
01245         if (rc < 0)
01246                 GOTO(out, rc);
01247 
01248         LASSERTF(rc <= rdpg->rp_count, "dt_index_read() returned more than "
01249                  "asked %d > %d\n", rc, rdpg->rp_count);
01250 
01251         /* send pages to client */
01252         rc = tgt_sendpage(tsi, rdpg, rc);
01253         if (rc)
01254                 GOTO(out, rc);
01255         EXIT;
01256 out:
01257         if (rdpg->rp_pages) {
01258                 for (i = 0; i < rdpg->rp_npages; i++)
01259                         if (rdpg->rp_pages[i])
01260                                 __free_page(rdpg->rp_pages[i]);
01261                 OBD_FREE(rdpg->rp_pages,
01262                          rdpg->rp_npages * sizeof(rdpg->rp_pages[0]));
01263         }
01264         return rc;
01265 }
01266 
01267 struct tgt_handler tgt_obd_handlers[] = {
01268 TGT_OBD_HDL    (0,      OBD_PING,               tgt_obd_ping),
01269 TGT_OBD_HDL_VAR(0,      OBD_LOG_CANCEL,         tgt_obd_log_cancel),
01270 TGT_OBD_HDL    (0,      OBD_IDX_READ,           tgt_obd_idx_read)
01271 };
01272 EXPORT_SYMBOL(tgt_obd_handlers);
01273 
01274 int tgt_sync(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_target *tgt,
01275              struct dt_object *obj, __u64 start, __u64 end)
01276 {
01277         int rc = 0;
01278 
01279         ENTRY;
01280 
01281         /* if no objid is specified, it means "sync whole filesystem" */
01282         if (obj == NULL) {
01283                 rc = dt_sync(env, tgt->lut_bottom);
01284         } else if (dt_version_get(env, obj) >
01285                    tgt->lut_obd->obd_last_committed) {
01286                 rc = dt_object_sync(env, obj, start, end);
01287         }
01288         atomic_inc(&tgt->lut_sync_count);
01289 
01290         RETURN(rc);
01291 }
01292 EXPORT_SYMBOL(tgt_sync);
01293 /*
01294  * Unified target DLM handlers.
01295  */
01296 
01312 static int tgt_blocking_ast(struct ldlm_lock *lock, struct ldlm_lock_desc *desc,
01313                             void *data, int flag)
01314 {
01315         struct lu_env            env;
01316         struct lu_target        *tgt;
01317         struct dt_object        *obj = NULL;
01318         struct lu_fid            fid;
01319         int                      rc = 0;
01320 
01321         ENTRY;
01322 
01323         tgt = class_exp2tgt(lock->l_export);
01324 
01325         if (unlikely(tgt == NULL)) {
01326                 CDEBUG(D_ERROR, "%s: No target for connected export\n",
01327                        class_exp2obd(lock->l_export)->obd_name);
01328                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01329         }
01330 
01331         if (flag == LDLM_CB_CANCELING &&
01332             (lock->l_granted_mode & (LCK_EX | LCK_PW | LCK_GROUP)) &&
01333             (tgt->lut_sync_lock_cancel == ALWAYS_SYNC_ON_CANCEL ||
01334              (tgt->lut_sync_lock_cancel == BLOCKING_SYNC_ON_CANCEL &&
01335               ldlm_is_cbpending(lock))) &&
01336             ((exp_connect_flags(lock->l_export) & OBD_CONNECT_MDS_MDS) ||
01337              lock->l_resource->lr_type == LDLM_EXTENT)) {
01338                 __u64 start = 0;
01339                 __u64 end = OBD_OBJECT_EOF;
01340 
01341                 rc = lu_env_init(&env, LCT_DT_THREAD);
01342                 if (unlikely(rc != 0))
01343                         RETURN(rc);
01344 
01345                 ost_fid_from_resid(&fid, &lock->l_resource->lr_name,
01346                                    tgt->lut_lsd.lsd_osd_index);
01347 
01348                 if (lock->l_resource->lr_type == LDLM_EXTENT) {
01349                         obj = dt_locate(&env, tgt->lut_bottom, &fid);
01350                         if (IS_ERR(obj))
01351                                 GOTO(err_env, rc = PTR_ERR(obj));
01352 
01353                         if (!dt_object_exists(obj))
01354                                 GOTO(err_put, rc = -ENOENT);
01355 
01356                         start = lock->l_policy_data.l_extent.start;
01357                         end = lock->l_policy_data.l_extent.end;
01358                 }
01359 
01360                 rc = tgt_sync(&env, tgt, obj, start, end);
01361                 if (rc < 0) {
01362                         CERROR("%s: syncing "DFID" ("LPU64"-"LPU64") on lock "
01363                                "cancel: rc = %d\n",
01364                                tgt_name(tgt), PFID(&fid),
01365                                lock->l_policy_data.l_extent.start,
01366                                lock->l_policy_data.l_extent.end, rc);
01367                 }
01368 err_put:
01369                 if (obj != NULL)
01370                         lu_object_put(&env, &obj->do_lu);
01371 err_env:
01372                 lu_env_fini(&env);
01373         }
01374 
01375         rc = ldlm_server_blocking_ast(lock, desc, data, flag);
01376         RETURN(rc);
01377 }
01378 
01379 static struct ldlm_callback_suite tgt_dlm_cbs = {
01380         .lcs_completion = ldlm_server_completion_ast,
01381         .lcs_blocking   = tgt_blocking_ast,
01382         .lcs_glimpse    = ldlm_server_glimpse_ast
01383 };
01384 
01385 int tgt_enqueue(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
01386 {
01387         struct ptlrpc_request *req = tgt_ses_req(tsi);
01388         int rc;
01389 
01390         ENTRY;
01391         /*
01392          * tsi->tsi_dlm_req was already swapped and (if necessary) converted,
01393          * tsi->tsi_dlm_cbs was set by the *_req_handle() function.
01394          */
01395         LASSERT(tsi->tsi_dlm_req != NULL);
01396         rc = ldlm_handle_enqueue0(tsi->tsi_exp->exp_obd->obd_namespace, req,
01397                                   tsi->tsi_dlm_req, &tgt_dlm_cbs);
01398         if (rc)
01399                 RETURN(err_serious(rc));
01400 
01401         switch (LUT_FAIL_CLASS(tsi->tsi_reply_fail_id)) {
01402         case LUT_FAIL_MDT:
01403                 tsi->tsi_reply_fail_id = OBD_FAIL_MDS_LDLM_REPLY_NET;
01404                 break;
01405         case LUT_FAIL_OST:
01406                 tsi->tsi_reply_fail_id = OBD_FAIL_OST_LDLM_REPLY_NET;
01407                 break;
01408         case LUT_FAIL_MGT:
01409                 tsi->tsi_reply_fail_id = OBD_FAIL_MGS_LDLM_REPLY_NET;
01410                 break;
01411         default:
01412                 tsi->tsi_reply_fail_id = OBD_FAIL_LDLM_REPLY;
01413                 break;
01414         }
01415         RETURN(req->rq_status);
01416 }
01417 EXPORT_SYMBOL(tgt_enqueue);
01418 
01419 int tgt_convert(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
01420 {
01421         struct ptlrpc_request *req = tgt_ses_req(tsi);
01422         int rc;
01423 
01424         ENTRY;
01425         LASSERT(tsi->tsi_dlm_req);
01426         rc = ldlm_handle_convert0(req, tsi->tsi_dlm_req);
01427         if (rc)
01428                 RETURN(err_serious(rc));
01429 
01430         RETURN(req->rq_status);
01431 }

01584 /* LFSCK request handlers */
01585 static int tgt_handle_lfsck_notify(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
01586 {
01587         const struct lu_env     *env = tsi->tsi_env;
01588         struct dt_device        *key = tsi->tsi_tgt->lut_bottom;
01589         struct lfsck_request    *lr;
01590         int                      rc;
01591         ENTRY;
01592 
01593         lr = req_capsule_client_get(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_LFSCK_REQUEST);
01594         if (lr == NULL)
01595                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
01596 
01597         rc = tgt_lfsck_in_notify(env, key, lr, NULL);
01598 
01599         RETURN(rc);
01600 }
01601 
01602 static int tgt_handle_lfsck_query(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
01603 {
01604         struct lfsck_request    *request;
01605         struct lfsck_reply      *reply;
01606         int                      rc;
01607         ENTRY;
01608 
01609         request = req_capsule_client_get(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_LFSCK_REQUEST);
01610         if (request == NULL)
01611                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
01612 
01613         reply = req_capsule_server_get(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_LFSCK_REPLY);
01614         if (reply == NULL)
01615                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01616 
01617         rc = tgt_lfsck_query(tsi->tsi_env, tsi->tsi_tgt->lut_bottom,
01618                              request, reply, NULL);
01619 
01620         RETURN(rc < 0 ? rc : 0);
01621 }

01625 TGT_LFSCK_HDL(HABEO_REFERO,     LFSCK_QUERY,    tgt_handle_lfsck_query),
01626 };
